meanings.definition: In a cautious or prudent manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked hooly through the dark forest, careful not to make a sound.
meanings.sent2: He approached the fragile vase hooly, afraid it might break.
meanings.sent3: The spy moved hooly through the crowded market, trying not to draw attention.
meanings.sent4: The cat crept hooly towards the unsuspecting bird, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent5: The old man hooly counted his coins, making sure not to miss any.

meanings.sent1: The leaves fell hooly from the tree, swirling in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent2: She stirred the soup hooly to avoid splashing hot liquid.
meanings.sent3: The baby slept hooly in the cozy crib, dreaming sweet dreams.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed hooly through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The clouds drifted hooly across the sky, changing shapes as they moved.

meanings.sent1: The ninja moved hooly in the shadows, unseen by the guards.
meanings.sent2: She slipped hooly out of the room, hoping not to wake anyone.
meanings.sent3: The thief snuck hooly into the mansion, avoiding the security cameras.
meanings.sent4: The spy observed the target hooly from a distance, gathering information.
meanings.sent5: The cat burglar climbed hooly up the wall, reaching the open window silently.
